definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: stupid/sluggish/clumsy/to wiggle (of worms)/to move in a disorderly fashion
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
even the wisest can have a momentary lapse in judgment (idiom)/every man has a fool in his sleeve
pinyin: cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , hu2 tu5 yi1 shi2

definition: clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
